name: Comparative Studies in Jewish and Non-Jewish Political Thought
description: A comparative examination of major texts of the Jewish tradition, ranging from the Torah to modernity, and texts of the classical or Western traditions raising similar questions. Close reading of a small number of capital works, with special attention to the problem of reason and revelation.
prerequisites: POL200Y1/POL200Y5/(POLC70H3, POLC71H3), POL320Y1/POL320Y5/POL323Y1/POL330Y1/POL355Y1/a relevant course in Jewish studies
